channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: The Senate passed legislation to expand healthcare and benefits for millions of veterans, especially those exposed to noxious chemicals https://t.co/NHQdXZ7t9u
More than 60% of CEOs see a recession coming in the next 12 to 18 months, and some think one is already here, according to a survey released Friday by the Conference Board https://t.co/TB3Sj7TvMU
SpaceX fired employees who criticized CEO Elon Musk and the way the company applies internal rules, according to an email to staff https://t.co/Vow4OlFpAI

The board of World Wrestling Entertainment appointed Stephanie McMahon as interim chief executive officer and chairwoman pending an investigation into alleged misconduct by her father and longtime head of the company, Vince McMahon. https://t.co/vW4D3l2x2S
China said it launched its newest and most advanced aircraft carrier that would expand Beijing’s military influence at sea #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/EfO4LHqw2b https://t.co/EgseaxJaLF
The EU recommended that Ukraine become an official candidate to join the bloc, a first step on a long path toward membership with many obstacles https://t.co/HSER8tvOBz
Scientists have discovered polar bears that have adapted to life without sea ice. It raises hopes the species can survive even as the climate warms. https://t.co/XaMYrrWJF3
Kate Bush is running up the charts https://t.co/0ps4fyWHk2
The Bank of Japan maintained ultra-low interest rates, confirming that it won’t join major global central banks in tightening monetary policy https://t.co/dlON2jdTj2
Two American men—both veterans—who volunteered to serve alongside Ukrainian forces are missing and feared captured by Russian forces, according to officials https://t.co/VDmuORs6f9
The Golden State Warriors won the NBA championship, defeating the Boston Celtics. It's the fourth title in eight seasons for the team and star Stephen Curry. https://t.co/yTINFlKwSb
The Dow plunged more than 700 points as stocks slid on recession concerns. The Nasdaq fell 4.1%. https://t.co/HgiJLjpE2W
World Cup organizers unveiled the host cities for the 2026 World Cup in the U.S., Canada and Mexico—and all 11 American stadiums are home to NFL teams https://t.co/PEG1nMFC2h

Israel has repeatedly struck Iran-related targets in Syria. Behind the scenes, many of Israel’s missions have been reviewed for approval by senior officials at U.S. Central Command and the Pentagon, sources say. https://t.co/eBmlOUt32V
Scientists have discovered polar bears that have adapted to life without sea ice. It raises hopes the species can survive even as the climate warms. https://t.co/e29kmeXrrF
The average rate for a 30-year fixed mortgage hit 5.78%, the highest level since 2008 https://t.co/h7lubWrcZa
U.S.-led coalition forces seized a man that officials described as a senior leader of Islamic State in an operation in northeast Syria late Wednesday https://t.co/aNhbhTmkEM
The U.S. is sending $1 billion in new military assistance to help Ukraine repel Russia’s invasion, in response to Kyiv’s urgent pleas #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/omkOqo7LBS https://t.co/Zk31ra5mOJ
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/AtwDUrxpfc https://t.co/m45MUGmuRB
Abbott Laboratories said it has paused baby-formula production at its Sturgis, Michigan, plant after storms flooded part of it, affecting production https://t.co/bnnuNMsXlu
Bill Gates said he thinks cryptocurrencies and NFTs are “100%” based on the greater fool theory https://t.co/JNyFKPpJO0
President Biden took a fresh shot at countering high gasoline prices by urging U.S. oil refiners to expand capacity and accusing them for profiteering https://t.co/JlRc8OFNDx

A fisherman has confessed to killing and dismembering British journalist Dom Phillips and his guide, Bruno Pereira, deep in the Amazon rainforest, Brazilian police said Wednesday https://t.co/SmhEGp87w9

Fourteen markets across Middle East and Southeast Asia have banned theatrical showings of “Lightyear,” the latest feature film from Disney's Pixar, because it depicts a same-sex relationship https://t.co/mmLEQNzMkX
If inflation has relegated you to window shopping, this summer’s surplus sales might give you a reason to go back inside https://t.co/G22siMq1r9
A federal judge in Washington has denied former Trump strategist Steve Bannon’s motion to throw out his indictment on contempt-of-Congress charges https://t.co/BrLdoaqKLy
The Federal Reserve raises rates by 0.75 points and signals a more aggressive path for interest-rate hikes #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/ZaJ0RxsK2v https://t.co/DvLwfWBpCb
R.I.P., Internet Explorer. Microsoft has pulled the plug on its venerable browser after more than 27 years. https://t.co/zpyv7vQk1A
A federal court has ruled that it is unconstitutional for a North Carolina charter school to require girls to wear skirts https://t.co/8FuzSno75c

Chinese leader Xi Jinping again fell short of publicly siding with Moscow over the invasion of Ukraine during a telephone call Wednesday with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin, according to an account from state broadcaster Chinese Central Television https://t.co/OUbvi9dHjV
Covid vaccines from Pfizer and Moderna were recommended for kids as young as 6 months by FDA advisers. It's the last major group waiting for the shots. https://t.co/NZrDnS9lgD

WWE’s board is investigating a secret $3 million settlement that longtime CEO Vince McMahon reached with a former employee with whom he allegedly had an affair, according to documents and people familiar https://t.co/FXdiFlpfiq
President Biden will sign an executive order aimed at improving protections for LGBT people that includes efforts to counter laws around transgender youths https://t.co/bGFmuWVW9w
Dr. Anthony Fauci has tested positive for Covid-19 https://t.co/AVqsSreve5
Bill Gates said he thinks cryptocurrencies and NFTs are “100%” based on the greater fool theory https://t.co/Ch4s4Ar5xM
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/aEo6WuZwdG https://t.co/Kova3KiQWT
For the first time, scientists have discovered where the Black Death originated from: a mountainous region of modern-day Kyrgyzstan https://t.co/TScW1p9zzF
Lego said it is going to spend $1 billion to build a factory in Virginia. The new facility is expected to create more than 1,700 jobs. https://t.co/b7TR2885tr

BP is taking the lead on a more-than-$30 billion project to produce massive amounts of hydrogen from renewable energy in Australia’s Outback, a major bet on a promising alternative fuel that is in growing demand but remains expensive https://t.co/Ir83ONFnnb
Bartenders beware! Coca-Cola is rolling out premixed cans of Jack and Coke. It will have about 5% alcohol and make it easy to have the classic cocktail without a bar. https://t.co/tgclCFKHlM
Returning office workers get creative to help their lonely dogs cope: "Judge Judy" and robotic vacuums https://t.co/qzhb2jbOT4
Minnesota Timberwolves owner and former Walmart executive Marc Lore’s new food-truck startup has a $3.5 billion valuation, and he wants to expand to new regions https://t.co/TFlCN0xnQa
R.I.P., Internet Explorer https://t.co/FVHjZOjdP9

Rep. Tom Rice, one of the 10 House Republicans who voted to impeach Donald Trump, has lost in a South Carolina primary, the AP projects. Trump-backed state Rep. Russell Fry won. https://t.co/fg5KnhDXmC
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/iKbVb1GK4A https://t.co/0CpccmUK6x
Where did officials go wrong on inflation? They applied an old playbook to a new crisis. “We fought the last war.” https://t.co/RoDK8kbXDV
All entrances to Yellowstone National Park are closed indefinitely, the National Park Service said, warning of dangerous conditions and the risk of rockslides https://t.co/wZyPOeld8q
Caterpillar is moving its headquarters to Texas from its longtime base in Illinois, the latest major manufacturer to leave the state in recent weeks https://t.co/dQrVBBm6Ta
The metaverse economy is expected to grow to $5 trillion by 2030 and encompass daily activities such as socializing and remote learning, consulting firm McKinsey said https://t.co/bACSPWDOK0
Crypto lender Celsius Network has hired restructuring lawyers to advise on possible solutions for its mounting financial problems https://t.co/LOGUEOH67U
